meanings.sent1: The unstitched shirt had loose threads hanging from the edges.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the unstitched hem of the dress for a more casual look.

meanings.definition: To undo or remove stitches from something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully unstitched the hem to adjust the length of the pants.
meanings.sent2: He had to unstitch the patch to fix the tear in his backpack.
meanings.sent3: The tailor accidentally unstitched the wrong part of the jacket, causing a small hole.
meanings.sent4: In a moment of frustration, she decided to unstitch the entire project and start over.
meanings.sent5: The child tried to unstitch the toy to see how it was made, but ended up breaking it.
